channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Inflation Cools to 2.9%, Shoring Up Case for a Fed Rate Cut
item.description: The Consumer Price Index reading in July was the mildest year-over-year increase since 2021.

item.title: Portraits of Survival: The Israeli Hostages Who Made It Home
item.description: They are now trying to rebuild their lives, campaign for the return of the hostages still in Gaza and mourn for those who were killed.

item.title: Bank of America tells junior execs to blow the whistle on managers who overwork them
item.description: Managers reportedly told employees to downplay how much they were working to avoid triggering an HR policy.

item.title: They All Got Mysterious Brain Diseases. They’re Fighting to Learn Why.
item.description: Doctors in Canada have identified dozens of patients with similar, unexplained symptoms — a scientific puzzle that has now become a political maelstrom.

item.title: Ukraine’s Surprise Attack on Russia
item.description: Amid the biggest foreign incursion into Russia since World War II, The New York Times visited a place where Ukrainian forces stormed in. Andrew E. Kramer, the Kyiv bureau chief for The New York Times, describes what he saw.

item.title: Schumer joins growing chorus of pro-crypto Democrats—but Harris keeps silent for now
item.description: A new grassroots organization is trying to stop the Trump crypto wave by hosting a town hall with top politicians and industry leaders.

item.title: W.H.O. Declares Global Emergency Over New Mpox Outbreak
item.description: The epidemic is concentrated in the Democratic Republic of Congo, but the virus has now appeared in a dozen other African countries.

item.title: W.H.O. Declares Global Emergency Over New Mpox Outbreak
item.description: The epidemic is concentrated in the Democratic Republic of Congo, but the virus has now appeared in a dozen other African countries.

item.title: Medical care and prescription costs among top 10 worries of older adults before 2024 election
item.description: Adults over 50 are a key demographic for candidates this election cycle.

item.title: Want to Fix the Immigration Mess? Make It Easier to Come Here Legally.
item.description: People who wish to come to America in search of a better life deserve a fair shot.

item.title: 2 Bases in Germany Placed on Heightened Alert Over Suspicious Episodes
item.description: The discovery led to the temporary lockdown of the base while the water supply was tested. NATO officials also reported that an intruder tried to forcibly enter one of the alliance’s bases in the country.

item.title: Inflation drops to 3-year low, sealing the deal for Fed to cut rates in September
item.description: Consumer prices rose just 0.2% from June to July and 2.9% on an annualized basis—the smallest increase since early 2021.

item.title: Hurricane Ernesto Knocks Out Power to Hundreds of Thousands in Puerto Rico
item.description: The island’s frail electrical system struggled as the storm passed on Wednesday.

item.title: Signs of Changing Russian Battle Plans as Ukraine Presses On With Assault
item.description: Russia has begun moving some troops from Ukraine to deal with an Ukrainian incursion, the U.S. and Ukraine say. But Moscow appears reluctant to withdraw troops from hot spots in eastern Ukraine.

item.title: Reporter caught using artificial intelligence to create fake stories and quotes
item.description: Aaron Pelczar, a 40-year-old who was new to journalism, admitted he had used AI in his stories before he resigned from Wyoming's Cody Enterprise.
